TopicTitle: How to add Permadeath to your save file (Persistence)

Articles.Content:
Hello everyone.

Now that .23.5 is out and a lot of People are starting new savegames, I wanted to leave this hear.

I was always wondering why there is a "Lost"-Tab in the Astronaout Complex if Kerbals Respawn after a while if they died.

So I wanted to add Permadeath to my new Savegame to make it a little bit more thrilling.

Unfortunately it was quite hard to find informations on how to do that, what is why I am posting this here.

What it will do:

Kerbals that achieve the goal of a firey, squishy or puffy death won't rise out of their graves anymore.

They will only show up in the "Lost"-Tab forever but do not respawn.

This Setting is only affecting the Savegame you edited it to, other savegames are still "Vanilla".

What you have to do:

Look up your Save-File in your KSP-Folder.

Inside of it, there is File called Persistence.cfg (If I recall correctly)

Open this file with your Editor/Notepad (If you are using a Windows-PC)

Press CTRL-F to search for entries and look for "MissingCrewRespawn = True"

Change this into "MissingCrewRespawn = False"

And you are set.

Hope you enjoy the thrill.
